title: web.delete Request Application Programming Interface (API) Schema
description: Performs a simple HTTP or HTTPS `DELETE` request against an external endpoint, and returns the response to the Notecard.

route.description: Alias for a Proxy Route in Notehub.

name.description: A web URL endpoint relative to the host configured in the Proxy Route. URL parameters may be added to this argument as well (e.g. `/deleteReading?id=1`).

body.description: The JSON body to send with the request.

content.description: The MIME type of the body or payload of the response. Default is `application/json`.

seconds.description: If specified, overrides the default 90 second timeout.

async.description: If `true`, the Notecard performs the web request asynchronously, and returns control to the host without waiting for a response from Notehub.

file.description: The name of the local-only Database Notefile (`.dbx`) to be used if the web request is issued asynchronously and you wish to store the response.

note.description: The unique Note ID for the local-only Database Notefile (`.dbx`). Only used with asynchronous web requests (see `file` argument above).

samples.description: Performs a simple HTTP or HTTPS DELETE request and returns the response.
